item.title: A Plethora of Free Android Phones
item.description: This Christmas, give the gift of a cutting-edge Android phone without breaking the bank. Although these devices boast advanced technology and typically come with a high price tag (often $500-$600), it’s possible to get one for free. Android smartphones are essentially pocket computers, running on 3G and 4G networks and offering similar functionality to desktops and laptops. They’re capable of web browsing, social networking, email, video streaming, and more. While $500-$600 might be reasonable for such a device, why pay when you can get one for free?

item.title: Alternative Rural Broadband Solution
item.description: For those living and working in rural areas, limited internet options can be a major problem. While major providers often only service cities, there are ways to stay connected without spending a fortune or waiting years for expanded infrastructure. Forget DSL or cable â€“ those are rare finds outside city limits. While universal telephone service guarantees basic phone lines (and thus, very slow dial-up internet), there’s a better option for fast, affordable internet: the existing cell phone network.

item.title: Pink Android Intercept Means Business
item.description: The Samsung Intercept, with its stylish satin pink exterior, could easily be described as “Pretty in Pink,” much like the classic 80s movie. This phone is more than just attractive; it’s also a highly capable device. This pink Android phone boasts a large 3-inch touchscreen display, providing access to a vast library of apps from the Android Market. What sets it apart from other touchscreen phones is its full slide-out QWERTY keyboard, enabling swift emailing, instant messaging, and texting.

item.title: Fascinated By The Samsung Fascinate
item.description: The Samsung Galaxy S series is a highly sought-after line of smartphones, offering a combination of style and advanced technology. The Samsung Fascinate, available through Verizon Wireless, is the newest member of this family. The Fascinate lives up to its name with a vivid 4-inch Super AMOLED display that’s easily viewable indoors and out. Its 1 GHz Hummingbird processor ensures smooth handling of demanding multimedia applications. The phone also boasts a 5-megapixel camera with autofocus and HD video recording capabilities, complemented by a DivX video player and an MP3 music player.

item.title: POS For Temporary Store Locations
item.description: A common sight during the holidays is the “pop-up shop.” These temporary stores occupy vacant spaces in malls and shopping centers, offering seasonal goods like decorations, costumes, and calendars. Once the season ends, so do their operations. Despite their temporary nature, these businesses require robust point-of-sale (POS) systems, even more so than traditional stores. The need for efficient POS systems stems from the concentrated bursts of customer traffic these stores experience.
